title: GM and Ford Trucks Are a Great Business. Why Their Stocks Don’t Reflect It.
text:
No one wants to buy auto stocks these days. It doesn’t feel smart to buy cyclical stocks at the end of a long-running economic expansion. That reluctance, however, could cause investors to overlook one of the most-profitable niches in the global car market: U.S. light trucks.

Americans love their trucks. More than 70% of new vehicles purchased in the U.S. are built on truck platforms. SUVs, for instance, count as light trucks as far as the industry is concerned. That is good news for General Motors (ticker: GM) and Ford Motor...
